content:
Apollo stood in front of Jack and Phil, his arms crossed over his chest. "So, Jack," he said, "I heard you used to have quite the sneeze back in high school."

Phil laughed. "Yeah, Jack's sneezes have only gotten bigger since then. You wouldn't believe it."

Apollo raised an eyebrow. "Really? Bigger?"

Phil nodded. "Oh yeah. I mean, have you seen the destruction a Jack sneeze can cause? The man could level a building with just one sneeze."

Apollo shook his head in disbelief. "I don't think I've ever heard of sneezes being that powerful."

Phil chuckled. "Well, you better believe it. I've seen it with my own two eyes. The man can clear out a room with one sneeze. And don't even get me started on the destruction it causes on a construction site. I'm talking smashed windows, broken pipes, knocked-over walls. The list goes on."

Apollo looked at Jack, who simply shrugged. "It's true," Jack said. "I can't control it. I've tried everything."

Apollo sighed. "Well, I hope nothing here at the reunion makes you sneeze."

Phil grinned. "Don't worry, I'll give you a heads up if Jack starts to feel a sneeze coming on."

The three of them shared a laugh as they walked away, the magnitude of Jack's sneezes still fresh in their minds.
